sen.j: 紀 夏井（き の なつい、生没年未詳）は平安時代初期の貴族、政治家。
sen.e: KI no Natsui (years of birth and death unknown) was a nobleman and a statesman who lived in the early Heian period.
sen.cmt: ここで「政治家」の定訳はpolitician/statesmanなのですが、前者は一般に悪いイメージが付随することから、後者を採用しております。
sen.e: KI no Natsui (years of birth and death unknown) was a nobleman and a statesman who lived in the early Heian period.
KI no Natsui (years of birth and death unknown) was a nobleman and a statesman who lived in the early Heian period.

sen.j: 大納言紀古佐美の曾孫。
sen.e: Natsui was a great grandson of Dainagon (Major Counselor) KI no Kosami.
Natsui was a great grandson of Dainagon (Major Counselor) KI no Kosami.
Natsui was a great grandson of Dainagon (Major Counselor) KI no Kosami.

sen.j: 美濃国国司紀善峯の子。
sen.e: Natsui's father was KI no Yoshimine who was a Kokushi (which was also called Kuni no tsukasa or Kunizukasa, which was a provincial government officer) of Mino Province.
Natsui's father was KI no Yoshimine who was a Kokushi (which was also called Kuni no tsukasa or Kunizukasa, which was a provincial government officer) of Mino Province.
Natsui's father was KI no Yoshimine who was a Kokushi (which was also called Kuni no tsukasa or Kunizukasa, which was a provincial government officer) of Mino Province.

Natsui had an official court rank of shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank) and was a Benkan (a Controller of the Oversight Department which was a division of the Daijokan responsible for controlling central and provincial governmental offices).

Natsui had an official court rank of shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank) and was a Benkan (a Controller of the Oversight Department which was a division of the Daijokan responsible for controlling central and provincial governmental offices).

Natsui had an official court rank of shogoi (Senior Fifth Rank) and was a Benkan (a Controller of the Oversight Department which was a division of the Daijokan responsible for controlling central and provincial governmental offices).

tit.cmt: 下記、再度「経歴」の項がありますので、区別しました。内容的には「人物」Personal Profileも適用できそうです。

sen.j: 天安 (日本)2年（858年）に讃岐国守、貞観_(日本)7年（865年）には肥後国守に任じ、いずれの任国においても善政を施し領民に慕われた。
sen.e: KI no Natsui was the Governor of Sanuki Province in 858 and the Governor of Higo Province in 865, and the both provinces did he govern wisely and the subject people admired him.
KI no Natsui was the Governor of Sanuki Province in 858 and the Governor of Higo Province in 865, and the both provinces did he govern wisely and the subject people admired him.
KI no Natsui was the Governor of Sanuki Province in 858 and the Governor of Higo Province in 865, and the both provinces did he govern wisely and the subject people admired him.

sen.j: その一方、能書家しても名高く、特に楷書の分野においては聖とまで言われるほどの才能を発揮した。
sen.e: Not only as a statesman, Natsui was also famed for his skillful hand, and particularly in the field of kaisho (basic, block style of writing Chinese characters) was he called a Shosei (who was a greatly talented and respected calligrapher).
sen.cmt: 「聖（ひじり）」は「書聖」として特定して訳出しました。
sen.e: Not only as a statesman, Natsui was also famed for his skillful hand, and particularly in the field of kaisho (basic, block style of writing Chinese characters) was he called a Shosei (who was a greatly talented and respected calligrapher).

Not only as a statesman, Natsui was also famed for his skillful hand, and particularly in the field of kaisho (basic, block style of writing Chinese characters) was he called a Shosei (who was a greatly talented and respected calligrapher).

sen.j: さらに囲碁の分野でも名人として名を馳せるなど、多様な才能を持つ能吏として、中央においても徐々にその名を浸透させていった。
sen.e: In addition, Natsui achieved national prominence in the field of the game of go, whose name thus became gradually well-known as a multi-talented and able official in the central government.
In addition, Natsui achieved national prominence in the field of the game of go, whose name thus became gradually well-known as a multi-talented and able official in the central government.
In addition, Natsui achieved national prominence in the field of the game of go, whose name thus became gradually well-known as a multi-talented and able official in the central government.

sen.j: しかし、貞観8年（866年）に応天門の変が起こり、異母弟の紀豊城が首謀者の一人として逮捕されると、夏井もこれに連座、肥後守の官職を解かれて土佐国に配流となった。
sen.e: In 866, however, the Otenmon incident occurred, in which KI no Toyoki who was Natsui's half brother with a different mother was arrested as a main culprit, which resulted in implicating Natsui, who was thereby amoved from the position of the Governor of Higo and banished ('hairu' in Japanese) to Tosa Province.

In 866, however, the Otenmon incident occurred, in which KI no Toyoki who was Natsui's half-brother with a different mother was arrested as a main culprit, which resulted in implicating Natsui, who was thereby removed from the position of the Governor of Higo and banished to Tosa Province.
sen.cmt: * half-brotherとしました。* removedに修正しました。* ('hairu' in Japanese)を削除しました。
sen.e: In 866, however, the Otenmon incident occurred, in which KI no Toyoki who was Natsui's half-brother with a different mother was arrested as a main culprit, which resulted in implicating Natsui, who was thereby removed from the position of the Governor of Higo and banished to Tosa Province.

sen.j: 土佐国へ護送中、肥後国の百姓等が夏井の肥後国外への移送を拒もうとしたり、讃岐国の百姓等は讃岐国内から土佐国の境まで夏井に付き随い別れを惜しんだという。
sen.e: It is said that as Natsui was escorted to Tosa Province, some peasants and the other subjects of Higo Province, on one hand, attempted to prevent Natsui from being transferred out of the province, and on the other hand, peasants and the other subjects of Sanuki Province followed Natsui from inside Sanuki Province to the border of Tosa Province, regretting at parting.

It is said that as Natsui was escorted to Tosa Province, some peasants and the other subjects of Higo Province, on one hand, attempted to prevent Natsui from being transferred out of the province, and on the other hand, peasants and the other subjects of Sanuki Province followed Natsui from inside Sanuki Province to the border of Tosa Province, regretting at parting.

It is said that as Natsui was escorted to Tosa Province, some peasants and the other subjects of Higo Province, on one hand, attempted to prevent Natsui from being transferred out of the province, and on the other hand, peasants and the other subjects of Sanuki Province followed Natsui from inside Sanuki Province to the border of Tosa Province, regretting at parting.

sen.j: その後の詳細は不明であるが、配所で没したとされる。
sen.e: The aftermath of Natsui's banishment is unclear, but he is believed to have died in exile.
The aftermath of Natsui's banishment is unclear, but he is believed to have died in exile.
The aftermath of Natsui's banishment is unclear, but he is believed to have died in exile.

sen.j: 中央・地方を問わず人望のあった夏井の失脚は、武内宿禰以来の名家である紀氏の政界における没落を決定的なものとした。
sen.e: Natsui was a personal magnetism regardless of where he was, in the capital or in the provinces, and therefore his downfall became a decisive factor to bring about the ruin of the Ki clan in politics, even if the house of Ki had been important since the time of Takeshiuchi no sukune (who was also called Takenouchi no sukune or Takeuchi no sukune, where the term 'sukune' is the title of honor in ancient Japan).

Natsui was a personal magnetism regardless of where he was, in the capital or in the provinces, and therefore his downfall became a decisive factor to bring about the ruin of the Ki clan in politics, even if the house of Ki had been important since the time of Takeshiuchi no sukune (who was also called Takenouchi no sukune or Takeuchi no sukune, where the term 'sukune' is the title of honor in ancient Japan).

Natsui was a personal magnetism regardless of where he was, in the capital or in the provinces, and therefore his downfall became a decisive factor to bring about the ruin of the Ki clan in politics, even if the house of Ki had been important since the time of Takeshiuchi no sukune (who was also called Takenouchi no sukune or Takeuchi no sukune, where the term 'sukune' is the title of honor in ancient Japan).

sen.j: この事件の後、同氏は宗教界や歌壇において活躍する氏族となっていく。
sen.e: After the downfall in politics, the Ki clan changed the scene of their activities into the fields of religion and poetry.
After the downfall in politics, the Ki clan changed the scene of their activities into the fields of religion and poetry.
After the downfall in politics, the Ki clan changed the scene of their activities into the fields of religion and poetry.

sen.j: 紀夏井が讃岐守の任期を終えて20余年後に、菅原道真が讃岐守として現地に赴任した際、讃岐国の百姓は紀夏井の善政を忘却しておらず、道真は紀夏井と何かと比較され国政運営で難渋したという逸話がある。
sen.e: After more than two decades passed since KI no Natsui had gone, SUGAWARA no Michizane was appointed Governor of Sanuki Province where its peasants remembered Natsui's good politics, and Michizane is said to have faced difficulties in running government affairs due to the people who wanted to contrast Michizane with Natsui in every aspect.

After more than two decades passed since KI no Natsui had gone, SUGAWARA no Michizane was appointed Governor of Sanuki Province where its peasants remembered Natsui's good politics, and Michizane is said to have faced difficulties in running government affairs due to the people who wanted to contrast Michizane with Natsui in every aspect.

After more than two decades passed since KI no Natsui had gone, SUGAWARA no Michizane was appointed Governor of Sanuki Province where its peasants remembered Natsui's good politics, and Michizane is said to have faced difficulties in running government affairs due to the people who wanted to contrast Michizane with Natsui in every aspect.
N.B. The date below is according to old lunar calendar.

sen.j: 9月27日、従五位下に叙し、右少弁に転任。
sen.e: September 27: Granted a court rank of jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and transferred to Ushoben (Minor Controller of the Right).
September 27: Granted a court rank of jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and transferred to Ushoben (Minor Controller of the Right).

sen.j: 1月7日、従五位上に昇叙し、右少弁如元。
sen.e: January 7: Raised to a court rank of jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), remaining in the position of Ushoben.
January 7: Raised to a court rank of jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), remaining in the position of Ushoben.
January 7: Raised to a court rank of jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), remaining in the position of Ushoben.
January 14: Concurrently served as Harima no suke (Assistant Governor of Harima Province).
January 14: Concurrently served as Harima no suke (Assistant Governor of Harima Province).
January 14: Concurrently served as Harima no suke (Assistant Governor of Harima Province).
May 8: Concurrently served as Shikibu no sho (which was also called Shikibu no shofu, Shikibu no shoyu and Shikibu no sunainosuke, meaning Junior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Ceremonial).
May 8: Concurrently served as Shikibu no sho (which was also called Shikibu no shofu, Shikibu no shoyu and Shikibu no sunainosuke, meaning Junior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Ceremonial).

June 19: Transferred to the position of Uchuben (Middle Controller of the Right).
June 19: Transferred to the position of Uchuben (Middle Controller of the Right).

sen.j: 式部少輔・播磨介如元。
sen.e: Remained in the position of the Shikibu no sho and the Harima no suke.
Remained in the position of the Shikibu no sho and the Harima no suke.

November 25: Appointed Governor of Sanuki Province.

sen.j: 任期満了の処、讃岐国百姓等の懇望により讃岐守を2年延任。
sen.e: At the expiration of his term of office of the Governor of Sanuki Province, the term was extended for two more years at the subject peasants' earnest request.
At the expiration of his term of office of the Governor of Sanuki Province, the term was extended for two more years at the subject peasants' earnest request.

January 27: Appointed Governor of Higo Province.

sen.j: 9月22日、応天門の変の罪人との血縁から連座の適用を受け土佐国へ配流となる。
sen.e: September 22: Banished to Tosa Province for allegedly being implicated in the Otenmon incident due to blood relationship with a main culprit.
September 22: Banished to Tosa Province for allegedly being implicated in the Otenmon incident due to blood relationship with a main culprit.
